<JD_START>
Job Title: Program Manager - Advanced Technology & Rapid Prototyping

Location: San Diego, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
Title

Program Manager - Advanced Technology & Rapid Prototyping

Location: North Charleston SC, San Diego, CA, DC/metro Area with flexibility with remote and hybrid teleworking.

Job Description

KBR is a leading provider of innovative solutions for defense, technology, and information systems, specializing in advanced technology experimentation and integration. We work closely with government agencies, including the Department of Defense (DoD), to deliver cutting-edge solutions that enhance national security and technological capabilities.

Job Overview

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Program Manager to lead enterprise-wide research, analysis, assessments, and testing of advanced technology experiments for a range of information technology solutions within the Department of the Navy (DoN). The Program Manager will be responsible for driving scientific and engineering innovation, executing rapid prototyping activities, and integrating prototype components into information warfare systems.

Key Responsibilities

Strategic Program Management:

Develop and execute program strategies aligned with the objectives of the Task Order (TO), focusing on enterprise-wide research, analysis, and experimentation.Coordinate with stakeholders to define project goals, deliverables, timelines, and success criteria.Manage the overall program budget, resources, risks, and quality standards.

Advanced Technology Experimentation

Lead and oversee advanced technology experiments, including rapid prototyping, testing, and integration activities.Collaborate with technical teams to design and refine advanced technology solutions for defense, weapons, manpower, logistics, enterprise IT, and business systems.Utilize Modeling and Simulation (M&S) and militarily relevant environments for experimentation and modernization.

Integration And Transition

Provide recommendations for integrating prototype components and designs into new or existing information warfare systems, such as Command and Control (C2) systems, communication systems, networking systems, cyber operations, ISR systems, and information security systems.Ensure seamless transition of advanced technologies and capabilities developed during the program to meet DoD critical technology areas, including wireless technology, Artificial Intelligence (AI), autonomy, integrated sensing and cyber, network systems-of-systems, space technology, and quantum science.

Stakeholder Engagement And Collaboration

Establish strong relationships with DoN stakeholders, government agencies, technical experts, and industry partners.Communicate program progress, updates, and key findings to stakeholders in a clear and timely manner.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to address challenges, mitigate risks, and achieve program objectives.

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in engineering, computer science, or related field (Master's degree preferred).Proven experience (13+ years) in program management, advanced technology experimentation, and integration within the defense or government sector.Strong understanding of scientific research methodologies, rapid prototyping processes, and technology transition strategies.Experience with Modeling and Simulation (M&S), virtual environments, and militarily relevant experimentation.Excellent leadership, communication, and stakeholder management skills.PMP is highly desirable.Individual may require 8140 / 8570 baseline certifications based on actual job duties.Active Secret clearance

Contract Award expected Summer 2024. Positions are contingent upon award and funding.

Scheduled Weekly Hours

40

Basic Compensation

$124,735 - $187,150

The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities and/or experience and in consideration of internal parity.

Additional Compensation

KBR may offer bonuses, commissions, or other forms of compensation to certain job titles or levels, per internal policy or contractual designation. Additional compensation may be in the form of sign on bonus, relocation benefits, short term incentives, long term incentives, or discretionary payments for exceptional performance.

Benefits

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include a 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

KBR is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

R2086969

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
